results.name: Number of solutions to a^2 + b^2 + 4*c^2 = n.
formula: G.f.: theta_3(q)^2*theta_3(q^4), where theta_3() is the Jacobi theta function. - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Aug 01 2018
